title: Organizational Learning Improvement Course Through Optimized Project Review Processes

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: A course for construction field practitioners to learn structured tools and methodologies for systematically organizing lessons learned from project reviews and applying them to organizational learning

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five core elements (planning, execution, evaluation, sharing, application) constituting the project review process.
Learners can utilize structured tools to analyze differences in project review effectiveness based on organizational scale and experience.
Learners can apply data analysis techniques to derive learning lessons based on survey results.
Learners can propose improvements to review processes using Total Quality Management (TQM) tools.
Learners can develop action plans to apply formative assessment-derived learning outcomes to actual project management.

resources: Project Review Template and Assessment Rubric
Case Study Materials (3 Construction Project Review Cases)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
